text: Share 176 shares 'Nothing has been better in my life than being your mama. Happy happy happy birthday to my favourite, funniest best person in the world. 'Ps we will obviously get you better shoes those are hideous I don't know what I was thinking.' Following her sweet tribute, Kate was inundated with happy birthday messages for her daughter from fans. Cute tribute: Kate said, 'Nothing has been better in my life than being your mama. Happy happy happy birthday to my favourite, funniest best person in the world' Kate also posted this fan collage, joking: It is comforting to know that the family "I am moments from throwing an elbow" face has been successfully passed down through the generations @kateandlily_' The Hollywood beauty raises daughter Lily with her ex Michael Sheen, who she dated from 1995 until 2003. Kate recently admitted in an interview with Too Fab that she got into a bit of trouble with her daughter over an Instagram post about her. While promoting her new film, Underworld: Blood Wars, the actress acknowledged that her daughter wasn't too happy about her parents enthusiasm over her college acceptance. 'I got into a bit of trouble at home for that,' Beckinsale said during the interview. Whoops! Kate admitted in an interview with Too Fab that she got into a bit of trouble with her daughter Lily Mo Sheen, 17, over her 'proud parent' moment She continued: 'She said, "I wish you'd said I got into the college of my choice, because it sounded like you had no hope of me getting into any college anywhere, made me sound like a loser!"' The actress and her ex Michael, 47, celebrated their daughter's achievements with the funny post on Thursday. In the sweet Instagram photo, the actress, leaped into the arms of her ex in sheer joy as they celebrated their girl's academic achievements. Kate wrote: 'The appropriate fatherly response when you find out your girl got into college: burst into tears, drop everything, rush over and pick up everyone even remotely involved. Modern family: Kate and Michael Sheen, 47, have stayed close since they split up, with the couple even posing together with Michael's new love Sarah Silverman '@lily_beckinsale we are so unbelievably proud of you . Fly fly fly.' (sic) The hilarious snap saw the Underworld star straddling the Welsh actor, 47, before he scooped Lily up into his arms. Kate's social media outpouring comes after Lily recently joked that her screen star parents were going to stop her from getting into college. And this isn't the first time she's embarrassed her daughter. When asked if she often gets into trouble she admitted: 'Sure, but that keeps it fun doesn't it?' Kate and Michael are very vocal advocates of their modern family life and have maintained a close bond ever since their split. 'We were very lucky in that we didn't have an acrimonious split,' the actress revealed in 2004 of her split with Sheen (seen here together in New York earlier this year) The actress said in an interview with InStyle magazine in 2004: 'We were very lucky in that we didn't have an acrimonious split. 'We are still very close and [our daughter] sees us around each other. He's absolutely one of my most favourite people ever. 'I love him dearly - I would miss him dreadfully if he wasn't in my life.'
